folder: Columbus Circle & [59th Street & Broadway.], Manhattan, NY
text:
Columbus Circle, west side from and including 59th Street, to Broadway. Also shown is 59th Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Columbus Circle.

About 1920.

I. Langran.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

Neg. #4104
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - [59th Street - Broadway.]

the Apostle (Roman Catholic).

folder: 59th Street (West) and Columbus Circle  , Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 64: 59th Street at Columbus Circle. These ragamuffins really are colored. This block, from Columbus Circle to Ninth Avenue, is part of the "San Juan Hill" negro colony, in the west 60's around Amsterdam
Avenue and west to the r iver.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 65. Staten Island, on the grounds of the U. S. Government Quarantine Station near Fort Wadsworth, on the east side of the Island. The church steeple is that of St. John's Protestant
Episcopal Church, on Bay Street.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.64-66.

space at f 50.000 rental per annum.
About 1934.
Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - [59th Street (West).]

text:
320-326 West 59th Street, south side, between Columbus Circle and
Ninth Ave. Nos. 320-324 are 3-story frame houses.
March 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

W. 59th Street, north side, from Columbus Circle (right of No. 3) to Columbus Avenue (left of No. 1) as viewed from a clearance on the south side, showing a panoramic set of 3 views. No. 1 shows a row of tenements (No's. 333 to 340) and a glimpse of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Paul the Apostle ; the latter being at the S.W. corner of Columbus Avenue and W. 60th Street and is an outstanding feature of New York containing numerous work of art. No. 2 shows buildings near the Circle. These bear No's. 311 and 313-315. They are repeated in No. 3, being at the foot of the 23 story Gotham National Bank Building (No. 307). Note that the latter is not on the Circle as a thin veneer of structures line same.
September 4, 1938
Views 1,2 and 3.
P.L. Sperr

W. 59th Street, north side, from Columbus Circle (right of No. 3) to Columbus Avenue (left of No. 1) as viewed from a clearance on the south side, showing a panoramic set of 3 views. No. 1 shows a row of tenements (No's. 333 to 340) and a glimpse of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Paul the Apostle ; the latter being at the S.W. corner of Columbus Avenue and W. 60th Street and is an outstanding feature of New York containing numerous work of art. No. 2 shows buildings near the Circle. These bear No's. 311 and 313-315. They are repeated in No. 3, being at the foot of the 23 story Gotham National Bank Building (No. 307). Note that the latter is not on the Circle as a thin veneer of structures line same.
September 4, 1938
Views 1,2 and 3.
P.L. Sperr

No. 1 shows a row of tenements (No's. 333 to 340) and a glimpse of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Paul the Apostle ; the latter being at the S.W. corner of Columbus Avenue and W. 60th Street and is an outstanding feature of New York containing numerous work of art. No. 2 shows buildings near the Circle. These bear No's. 311 and 313-315. They are repeated in No. 3, being at the foot of the 23 story Gotham National Bank Building (No. 307). Note that the latter is not on the Circle as a thin veneer of structures line same.
September 4, 1938
Views 1,2 and 3.
P.L. Sperr

West 59th Street, south side, between Columbus Circle and Ninth Avenue, showing a clearance there extending to 58th Street. The direction of the view is eastward from a point near Ninth Avenue. At the far end of the parking space are several buildings; that with the white stripe is the Park Theatre. This is entered from the Circle where a corner abuts. The balance of the building is on 58th Street. In the background is the General Motors Bldg. and its neighbors,
all on Broadway.
Hay 21, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

West 59th Street, south side, between Columbus Circle and Ninth Avenue, showing a clearance there extending to 58th Street. The direction of the view is eastward from a point near Ninth Avenue. At the far end of the parking space are several buildings; that with the white stripe is the Park Theatre. This is entered from the Circle where a corner abuts. The balance of the building is on 58th Street. In the background is the General Motors Bldg. and its neighbors,
all on Broadway.
Hay 21, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

West 59th Street, north side, between Columbus Circle and Ninth Avenue, as photographed northward across the clear-ance between 58th and 59th Street's. The 23 story office structure at the right is the Gotham National Bank Bldg. This bears No. 303-7 West 59th Street and is slightly west of the Circle. In the left midground appears the twin huttresses of St. Paul the Apostle R. C. Church on Ninth Ave.
May 21, 1939
No's. 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

West 59th Street, north side, between Columbus Circle and Ninth Avenue, as photographed northward across the clear-ance between 58th and 59th Street's. Columbus Avenue, north from W. 60th Street as photographed from the downtown 59th Street station of the 9th Avenue "El". At the left is a new apartment building at the N. W. corner of 60th Street. Above same is the 12 Regiment Armory. The Uppercue Building (70 Columbus Avenue) is opposite the Hotel Empire. Obscuring the latter is the towering Kent Garage.
June 6, 1940
P. L. Sperr

Columbus Ave., east side, north from a point slightly north of West 59th Street. This thoroughfare after crossing this point loses its former identity as Ninth Ave. On the right is Kaskel's Pawn Shop (No. 9 Columbus Ave.) a well known feature of this area.

November 25, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

Pawn Shop, 9 Columbus Avenue, east side, between 59th and 60th Streets.

April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Neg. #813

folder: Columbus Circle & Broadway & 59th Street (West)., Manhattan, NY
text:
Columbus Circle, the intersecting hub point of Broadway, 59th Street, Central Park West and 8th Avenue-and an avenue leading on the east side through the park. The monument to Columbus, will be noted in the center of the circle.

No Record of Photography

no date c 1900
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 59th Street (West).
